name: Mark Elliot Zuckerberg
achievements: Became the world's youngest self-made billionaire in 2008
Net worth of $214.1 billion as of March 2025
legacy: Revolutionized social media and digital communication.

name: Elon Musk
known_for: Founder of Neuralink and The Boring Company
achievements: Founded SpaceX in 2002 and Tesla in 2004
Revolutionized reusable rockets and electric vehicles
Founded OpenAI in 2015, co-founded Neuralink in 2016, and launched The Boring Company in 2017
Acquired Twitter and rebranded it as X in 2023
Net worth of $330 billion as of March 2025
Named Time's Person of the Year in 2021
legacy: Pioneer in electric vehicles, space exploration, and renewable energy.

name: Bill Gates
known_for: Philanthropy through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation
achievements: Held positions of CEO, president, and chairman at Microsoft
Transitioned to philanthropy, focusing on climate change, global health, and education
philanthropy: Established the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation
Led early 21st-century vaccination campaigns, contributing to the eradication of wild poliovirus in Africa
Founder of the Giving Pledge, a commitment by billionaires to donate a significant portion of their wealth
legacy: One of the wealthiest individuals in the world, influential in both technology and global philanthropy.

name: Jeffrey Preston Bezos
achievements: Founded Amazon in 1994, which became the world's largest e-commerce and cloud computing company
Founded Blue Origin in 2000, a private aerospace manufacturer and sub-orbital spaceflight company
Purchased The Washington Post in 2013 for $250 million
legacy: Revolutionized e-commerce, cloud computing, and space exploration.
